cause.description:
This cause is for changing the Red Cross's policy of not allowing any male who has engaged in a sexual act with another male since 1977 to donate blood.
1. All of the blood donated to the Red Cross is checked for HIV/AIDS. Straight people can get HIV/AIDS just as easy as homosexuals.
2. Since the discovery/awareness of HIV/AIDS has come about, the percentage of homosexual males with AIDS has decreased significantly and is almost equal to infected straight men.
cause.mission: Change the Red Cross's rule of gay males can't donate blood.
cause.name: Red Cross Needs To Know That Anyone Can Get HIV/AIDS
